newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Ahold Q1 net profit rises 69 pct to dfl 234.4 mln.
newsitem.headline: Ahold Q1 net profit rises 69 pct to dfl 234.4 mln.

text.p: Dutch supermarkets group Ahold NV reported a 69 percent increase in 1997 first quarter net profit to 234.4 million guilders ($121 million).
It repeated its forecast it expected 1997 earnings to be considerably higher than those of 1997.
Ahold said the sharp rise in net earnings was mainly attributable to last year's acquisition of U.S. supermarket chain Stop & Shop.
The stronger dollar -- worth an average 1.87 guilders in the first quarter of 1997 compared with 1.65 guilders in the same period of 1996 -- also had a positive impact.
Exchange rate movements, mainly in the dollar-guilder rate, added some 15.2 million guilders to net earnings or 0.09 guilders to earnings per share.

First quarter sales rose 48 percent to 14.0 billion guilders. Ahold said the increase in first quarter sales would have been only 17 percent if Stop & Shop had also been included in consolidated sales figures for the first quarter of 1996.
